io.oddworks.device.request

Class PollingAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.oddworks.device.request.PollingAuthenticator

  • public class PollingAuthenticator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for polling authentication server until an auth code is generated
    Since:
    v1.0 on 9/24/15

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <any> authenticate()
      Begin polling for an AuthToken.
      boolean authenticate(OddCallback<AuthToken> callback)
      If not expired then this will continue polling the server until time expires or an auth token is obtained Callback.onFailure will be completed with DeviceCodeExpiredException if this object expires without getting an auth token.
      void cancelAuthentication()
      if this object is authenticating using the callback based authenticate method, then this will cancel future authentication requests.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserCode

        public java.lang.String getUserCode()

      • getVerificationUrl

        public java.lang.String getVerificationUrl()

      • cancelAuthentication

        public void cancelAuthentication()
        if this object is authenticating using the callback based authenticate method, then this will cancel future authentication requests. if using authenticate that returns an Observable, then this has no effect.

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()

      • isAuthenticating

        public boolean isAuthenticating()
        Returns:
        true if currently polling for authentication token. Otherwise false. note: if authenticating through observable authenticate method, then this will return false. It only returns true if authenticating using the callback based authenticate method

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate(OddCallback<AuthToken> callback)
        If not expired then this will continue polling the server until time expires or an auth token is obtained Callback.onFailure will be completed with DeviceCodeExpiredException if this object expires without getting an auth token. It's not neccessary to use this method if you are using the rxAuthenticate method
        Returns:
        true if polling started, otherwise false (expired)

      • authenticate

        public <any> authenticate()
        Begin polling for an AuthToken. Unsubscribing will stop polling for an AuthToken. PollingAuthenticator.cancelAuthentication and PollingAuthenticator will have no effect.
        Returns:
        an observable that will emit 1 AuthToken or 1 exception. 404 responses will not be emitted. If this instance of PollingAuthenticator expires, then a BadResponseCodeException will be emitted

      • serialize

        public java.lang.String serialize()
        Returns:
        a string representation of this object which can be used in PollingAuthenticator.fromSerialized

      • fromSerialized

        public static PollingAuthenticator fromSerialized(java.lang.String serialized)
        Parameters:
        serialized - a string returned by PollingAuthenticator.serialize()
        Throws:
        RestServicesNotInitialized - if this method was called before RestServicesProvider was initialized.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
